original: 'phags pa bu mang po so sor 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: 'phags pa bu mang po so sor 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī Called The Individual Protection of Many Children

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra rba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra rba na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Jeta Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis bcom ldan ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis bcom ldan ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: bcom @289a *// ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom @289a *// ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bdag deng 'dir rgyal po gsal rgyal dang 'thab rtsod mtshang brus te bkye bar gyur na /
analyzed: bdag deng 'dir rgyal po gsal rgyal dang 'thab rtsod mtshang brus te bkye bar gyur na /
translated: Today I have been quarreling, arguing, and disputing with King Prasenajit.

translated: The Blessed One replied to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, “Householder,

analyzed: khyim bdag / de'i phyir khyod kyis bu mang po so sor 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i rig sngags 'di zungs shig /

original: khyim bdag / gang la la zhig bu mang po so sor 'brang ba'i gzungs 'di skud pa dmar po la lan bdun bsngags te lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo gcig la bcing sna /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gang la la zhig bu mang po so sor 'brang ba'i gzungs 'di skud pa dmar po la lan bdun bsngags te lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo gcig la bcing sna /
translated: Householder, whoever recites this Dhāraṇī of the Many Sons seven times on red thread and ties it to one of the fingers of the left hand,

original: de'i lus la dug dang / mtshon dang / nad dang / rims nad dang / rims drag pos mi tshugs so //
analyzed: de'i lus la dug dang / mtshon dang / nad dang / rims nad dang / rims drag pos mi tshugs so //
translated: his body will not be harmed by poison, weapons, illness, epidemics, or severe fevers.

original: 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa rnams kyi lan thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa rnams kyi lan thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be able to answer back in debates, disputes, and arguments.

original: bcom ldan @289b ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan @289b ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, the householder Anāthapiṇḍada rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words.

original: 'phags pa so sor 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa so sor 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī called The Individual is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: Translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Dānaśīla, and the chief editor and translator Bandé Yeshé Dé.
